title: Here's everything coming to Hulu in April 2022 — and what's leaving
text:
The biggest new title is “The Karsashians” (April 14), which basically picks up where E's “Keeping Up With the Karsashians” left off after ending its 20-season run in March. Fans can expect exactly the same stuff (for better or worse) from Kris, Kim, Khloe, Kendall and the rest of the family.

Meanwhile, the surreal comedy “Woke” (April 8) returns for its second season, with Lamorne Morris starring as a Black cartoonist who's trying to balance art and social activism.

The teen mystery series “The Hardy Boys” (April 6) is back for its season season as well, with the two young detectives investigating a classmate's kidnapping. The Disney DIS-controlled streaming service will also add a pair of FX originals, with new episodes streaming a day after they air on cable: Season 4 of the motorcycle-gang drama “Mayans M.C.” (April 20), and “Under the Banner of Heaven” (April 28), a limited series based on the Jon Krakauer book about a 1984 murder in Utah and a Mormon detective (played by Andrew Garfield) whose faith is tested as he uncovers secrets involving the Church of Latter-Day Saints.

Also:More streaming picks at What's Worth Streaming

Hulu is also adding all four movies in the “Twilight” saga, as well as films such as “Crank,” “Eyes Wide Shut,” “Love Actually,” “Shrek” and “Watchmen” (all April 1).

Here's the complete list of what's coming and going, as of March 20 (release dates are subject to change):
